entry.title: How to Create Material Document Movements with Reference to Purchase Order in SAP public cloud (3SL)
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I am working on SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud (3-System Landscape) and I have a requirement to create material document movements with reference to a Purchase Order (PO).

Could you please guide me on the following points:

  • How to create Goods Receipt (GR) or other material document movements with reference to a PO in the Public Cloud environment?

  • Are there any standard released APIs or CDS views available to post material documents in the Public Cloud?

  • Can this process be handled via a custom RAP application or background job using available public APIs?

  • Any example implementation or official documentation/blog references would be very helpful.

   Thank you in advance

Thanks & Regards,
Sanjay

entry.title: Replication of contracts from SAP SOM to CI /FI-CA only
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

We are testing the replication of subscription contracts from SAP SOM to SAP CI. Currently, the fulfillment steps in the subscription contract throw the following error (see snapshot):

“Joint replication of all master data to SAP CC not active.”

Upon investigation, this appears to be caused by the ODI distribution step CL_CRM_ISX_ORDER_MD_ERP_MCC (Step Type: PCEA).

SAP Convergent Charging (CC) is not activated in our S/4 system. We want subscription contracts to be distributed as provider contracts only to SAP Convergent Invoicing (CI). Could you please advise on how to achieve this? Any guidance would be greatly appreciated.

Best Regards,

Al

entry.title: Re: Some ACDOCA entries missing in ACDOCU after GRPL (Rel...
entry.content:
Dear Melis,

OSS note 3412034 gives guidance regarding the error "1) Release of Universal Journals (aka Data Release Task) is not taking over any data/ incomplete data".

Have you checked it already?

Furthermore, SAP will probably ask you to implement all notes from the collective note 3468806.

Finally, there is the note 3446304, which helped us in out case with missing documents from ACDOCA.

This is what I can tell from the issues we had last year.

Best regards
Felix

entry.title: Re: Issue with sales order creation
entry.content:
The difference between VA01 & BAPI is

In VA01, the ATP check and schedule line determination are fully executed before SAVE_DOCUMENT_PREPARE is triggered. So by the time your user exit runs, XVBEP[] is fully populated.

In BAPI_SALESORDER_CREATEFROMDAT2, the ATP check and schedule line determination may not be completed yet when SAVE_DOCUMENT_PREPARE is triggered. This means XVBEP[] might only contain the initial schedule line (e.g., with 0 confirmed quantity), and the second line is added later in the process. The BAPI doesn’t commit changes automatically. If the external system calls BAPI_TRANSACTION_COMMIT after the BAPI, the second schedule line might be added after your user exit has already run.

You mentioned XVBEP[] in one place and XVBRP[] in another. Just to clarify:

  • Delivery schedule proposals are not stored in XVBRP[]

Make sure you're consistently checking XVBEP[] in all the cases.

I would recommend to follow the below steps

Use VBEP Instead of XVBEP in BAPI Context. If XVBEP[] is not fully populated, consider reading directly from VBEP using the item number (VBAP-POSNR) and sales document number (VBAK-VBELN) — but only if the document has already been created.

If your logic depends on finalized schedule lines, consider moving it to a later user exit like SAVE_DOCUMENT (after the document is saved) or USEREXIT_SAVE_DOCUMENT in MV45AFZZ

Force ATP check in BAPI input and that the schedule lines are passed correctly to trigger ATP.

entry.title: Re: Forecasting in Intercompany Stock Transfer Scenario
entry.content:
Hi @Sindhu_Ravi 

Actually your process is called intercompany sales (SAP Help Working with Intercompany Sales Processing), not intercompany stock transfer (SAP Help Working with Intercompany Stock Transfer). That is what mislead my initial response.

I think the easiest way to solve your issue is to enter the forecast / demand plan in the supplying plant, i.e. plant A. 

Best regards

Dominik Tylczynski

entry.title: Re: Bank reprocess allocating payments to the wrong custo...
entry.content:
Hi @kezelda , 

I'm afraid I can't help you 100%, and I don't know why that problem occurs to you. However perhaps you could try and create more "specific" processing rules? That means, processing rules with more detailed actions?
You can, for example, select the AP/AR Posting action type and select specific customer or supplier accounts to be posted to in the processing  rule. Or you could try the Clear in Sequence action type and select a sequence of processing instructions that can process your items one after another.

These alternative actions might be more useful for your case than the 001 interpretation algorithm. For more information, see: 

  • How to Create Processing Rules 
  • Overview on All Predelivered Processing Instructions 
  • Allocation Algorithms

Best regards,
Anita

entry.title: Re: End-to-End Visual Inspection Process in SAP Digital Manufacturing
entry.content:
Hi Sunita, 

you need VI_Models_Admin for Manage Machine Learning Models and VI_Results_Admin for Manage Visual Inspection Results. Refer to https://help.sap.com/docs/sap-digital-manufacturing/operations-guide/granular-role-templates.

To train models, you require an additional role template ( VI_Model_Training) and you need to activate Premium AI in SAP DM. Refer to https://help.sap.com/docs/sap-digital-manufacturing/operations-guide/ai-functionalities-in-sap-digital-manufacturing

entry.title: Re: Understanding the Behavior of the Payment Block in th...
entry.content:
Hello @SatoMasayoshi 

The Payment Block in Manage Supplier Master (company code view) is a default setting that adds a payment-block key to new supplier items, excluding them from Manage Automatic Payments unless unblocked at the item level. It doesn’t change old items retroactively or stop postings. SAP Help Portal-Block Master Data - Customer & Supplier

If your goal is to prevent postings entirely, use a central posting block on the business partner

Block reasons or keys used on items are stored in “Define Reasons for Payment Blocks” (configuration). SAP Help Portal-Changing Payment Block and Payment Method

With best regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Restrict users from editing a parked invoice
entry.content:
Since:

  • You’re not using workflow,
  • You want to restrict editing parked invoices,
  • And the catalog SAP_FIN_BC_AP_INV_MGMT_PC is unavailable,

Here’s what you can do:

Look for catalogs like:

These catalogs may vary by tenant and release version. Use the “Maintain Business Roles” app to search for catalogs containing “AP_INV” or “INVOICE”.

In the Maintain Business Roles app, select the role assigned to restricted users. Go to Maintain Restrictions.

For relevant catalogs:

  • Set Write Access → No Access or Restricted
  • Set Read Access → Unrestricted

Use available Restriction Types like:

  • Document Type
  • Company Code
  • Posting Status (if available)

Since Invoice Status is not available, Posting Status may help distinguish parked vs. posted invoices.

If standard role restrictions are insufficient, consider custom Business logic via In-App extensibility, BAdI Implementation (if allowed in public cloud), Field Control or UI Adaptation to disable edit buttons based on status. These options depend on your edition and extensibility scope.

entry.title: Re: How to Create Material Document Movements with Refere...
entry.content:
SAP provides two key APIs for Material Document Posting

  • API_MATERIAL_DOCUMENT_SRV (OData) Material Documents - Read, Create
  • MATERIALDOCUMENTCREATEREQUEST1 (SOAP) Material Document - Create 

You can build a custom RAP (RESTful ABAP Programming Model) application or schedule background jobs that consume these APIs:

RAP App: Use API_MATERIAL_DOCUMENT_SRV in your service binding to post GRs from a Fiori app or external trigger.

Background Job: Use the SOAP API for batch processing of GRs, especially for high-volume or scheduled operations.

Make sure to assign the correct communication scenario (SAP_COM_0108), Configure communication arrangements in the Communication Management app. Use Business Catalogs like SAP_MM_BC_INV_DOC_PROC_PC for role-based access

entry.title: Re: Automatic quantity confirmation via TAG
entry.content:
Hello Jair,

If the relevant quantity is provided via Tag form the automation equipment and is processed in a PPD, the intended use would be to call the SFC Complete API/Service directly in that PPD (or a second sub-PPD if required). the POD can be subscribed to SFC Events and will automatically update the displayed quantities (in work and completed).

But maybe this is not the process you intend to implement? Maybe you want only want to provide the quantity to the operator and they should then manually trigger the next steps on the POD? than maybe you could use the machine input to start this poartial quantity via the SFC Start API/Service.

Let me know if this helps or if I went in the wrong direction.

Best regards, Michael

entry.title: Re: A production order compnonent material 101 mvmt displ...
entry.content:
In MB51, double-click the material document. Check the reference document. Is it linked to a production order, purchase order, or other document? Look at the document header → field Reference Document (AUFNR) or Order Number. If the reference is not a production order, the movement may have been posted manually or via another process (e.g., MIGO, MB1A).

Go to CO03 → enter the production order. Navigate to Component Overview. Check if the material is listed as a component. If yes:

  • Look at the withdrawal status and movement history.
  • If no movement is recorded, the 101 movement may not be linked to this order.

entry.title: New How-To Guides for Adapting Floorplan Manager Applications in SAP S/4HANA 2025
entry.content:
In this blog I would like to draw your attention to two new How-To Guides that explain in detail how to create, enhance, and adapt Floorplan Manager (FPM) applications in the latest SAP S/4HANA releases.

Many SAP S/4HANA and SAP S/4HANA Cloud UIs are based on Floorplan Manager for Web Dynpro ABAP. This proven UI technology continues to play an important role in SAP S/4HANA 2025 and provides powerful capabilities for customer-specific adaptations without modification.

1. How to Create, Enhance, and Adapt FPM Applications for SAP S/4HANA 2025 (On-Premise and Private Cloud Edition)

This guide, valid for SAP_UI 8.16 (delivered with ABAP Platform 2025 as part of SAP S/4HANA 2025), provides a comprehensive overview of the different options that Floorplan Manager offers for customer adaptations and discusses their advantages and drawbacks.

It covers in detail how to:

  • Create and structure an FPM-based application

  • Adapt applications using Customizing, Enhancement, Deep-Copy, and Context-Based Adaptations (CBA)

  • Use the FPM Application Hierarchy Browser and FLUID (Flexible UI Designer)

  • Apply best practices to choose the right adaptation technique for your scenario

With ABAP Platform 2025, the guide also introduces updates to the FPM Mobile Enabler and improved transport handling for Context-Based Adaptations (CBAL/CBAS objects).

Download the guide (PDF)

2. How to Adapt Floorplan Manager Applications as of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508

This second guide focuses on adaptation options available for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (Release SAP_BASIS 916 / S/4HANA 2508).

It explains how key users (with role SAP_BR_EXTENSIBILITY_SPEC) can adapt FPM applications via:

  • Customizing using the Adapt UI function

  • Context-Based Adaptations (CBA) for role- or device-specific variants

  • Transport of adaptations using Software Collections via the Export / Import Software Collection apps

The document includes step-by-step examples on how to simplify an FPM application and make it responsive for mobile devices using CBAs and the Device Type dimension.

Download the guide (PDF)

Both documents have been updated for the 2025 releases and provide a consistent, hands-on overview of the adaptation capabilities of Floorplan Manager in both On-Premise/Private Cloud and Public Cloud environments.

entry.title: How Can Predictive Maintenance in Dynamics 365 Field Service Be Optimized Using AI and IoT Data ?
entry.content:
Hi all, I’m currently managing a multi-site field service operation and exploring ways to leverage Dynamics 365 Field Service to its full potential. We have numerous assets deployed across different locations, and downtime is significantly impacting our operational efficiency.

I’m particularly interested in understanding how we can use AI-driven predictive maintenance combined with IoT sensor data within Dynamics 365 Field Service to:

Automatically predict equipment failures before they occur.

Prioritize work orders based on asset criticality and risk.

Optimize scheduling and dispatching for technicians across multiple sites.

Integrate predictive insights into our existing dashboards for real-time decision-making.

Has anyone successfully implemented a setup like this? What are the best practices, pitfalls, or advanced configurations (including custom workflows, AI models, or Power Automate integrations) that you would recommend to maximize uptime and reduce emergency maintenance costs?

Any insights, case studies, or architectural suggestions would be greatly appreciated!

entry.title: Re: Access CDS Objects Exposed as SQL Services Using Microsoft SQL Server
entry.content:
Hi,
we are still stepping in the dark. The trace looks fine. Only at the end it is somehow corrupted.
We have discovered an RFC bug that caused intermittent problems when the ODBC driver was used in HANA SDA and will publish a new driver patch shortly. I hope that this RFC bug fix will also fix your intermittent problems.

If the new driver patch does not help we may need to look at an RFC trace. To activate the RFC trace you need to set the following property in the connection string ( RfcTrace=debug ). This is our last resort since the RFC trace is very verbose and may write a large amount of data.
Regards
                   Frank

entry.title: Re: Report on SAP Signavio Process Intelligence data using the new OData API and SAP Analytics Cloud
entry.content:
A small adjustment is required if the odata view exposes durations using the signavio data type Duration.

This becomes an odata data type Edm.Duration which is incorrectly mapped to Timestamp in Datasphere and generic in SAP Analytics cloud.

You should apply the function DURATION_TO_MILLISECONDS in the odata view and avoid the headache 🙂

entry.title: Event-Based Revenue Recognition – New target navigation to Project Financial Booklets
entry.content:
What's New?

With the release of SAP S/4HANA Cloud 2602, SAP has introduced a target navigation from the monitoring app Event-Based Revenue Recognition – Projects (F4767) to Project Financial Booklets . This update improves the reporting capabilities for project margin, costs, revenue, and planning data.

This enhancement allows users to access detailed financial insights directly from the object page of the monitoring app via the Related Apps dropdown menu.

Context-Sensitive Navigation

The target navigation is dynamically determined based on the project type:

  • For Project-Based Services (CPM projects), the system proposes navigation to: Project Financial Booklet – Professional Services (F7479)
  • For Project-Based Sales (EPPM projects), the system proposes navigation to: Project Financial Booklet – Enterprise Projects (F8698)

Visual Examples

Here are examples of how the navigation appears for each project type:

Professional Services Booklet

Enterprise Projects Booklet

entry.title: Re: Error Message QA495 during MIGO - Unable to move insp...
entry.content:
Hello @Sidram 

The root cause of the issue (it is not really an error) is the fact that your material is QM managed. Therefore any postings changing quality stock of the material has to be executed from QM level. That's exactly what the message says. That restriction is to keep MM and QM data consistent.

Best regards

Dominik Tylczynski

entry.title: Re: Error Message QA495 during MIGO - Unable to move insp...
entry.content:
Why you see the error message QA495 is because, when inspection type 01 (goods receipt inspection for purchase order) is active in the material master, SAP expects all inspection stock movements to be handled within the QM module, not via inventory transactions like MIGO or MB1B. Movement type 321 is valid, but only when triggered automatically after a usage decision is made in transaction QA11 or QA32.

To fix this, use transaction QA11 (or QA32 for mass processing), Enter the inspection lot number, Make the usage decision (e.g., "Accepted"), In the stock posting tab, choose to move stock to Unrestricted and save the decision — SAP will automatically post movement type 321.

Go to mm02 for that material and navigate to QM view. Confirm that inspection type 01 is active. If you want to allow manual movement, you’d need to deactivate inspection type 01 — but this is not recommended unless you're changing your quality process.

entry.title: Selecting service plan for SAP Ariba Central invoice management
entry.content:
Hi all

We want to have Peppol e-invoicing solution in Germany.

Invoice flow for inbound invoices will be Supplier > Peppol Network> DRC > SAP Ariba CIM > S/4 HANA Public cloud.

During integration, we need to choose suitable service plan for SAP Ariba Central Invoice Management (CIM).

CIM and S/4 public cloud integrate seamlessly and are covered under scope item 4N6.

When read set up instructions for 4N6, it says that the set up by booster by default chooses service plan as ''scim''.

https://help.sap.com/docs/link-disclaimer?site=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.sap.com%2Fcontent%2Fdam%2FSAAP%2FSol_Pack%2FS4C%2FLibrary%2FSetup%2F4N6_Set-Up_EN_XX.pdf

 

however, in the Peppol integration SAP content , it asks us to choose CIM service plan as ''Inbound - drc''

https://help.sap.com/docs/cloud-edition/sap-document-and-reporting-compliance-cloud-edition/integrate-cloud-edition-with-sap-s-4hana-cloud

Whereas a BTP account global administrator or a person setting up the system, when he accesses SAP BTP cockpit, he sees below service plans to choose from - 

Thus getting very much confused about which plan to choose from.

Another question is - in set up instructions 4N6, it clearly says that there are 2 licenses viz. a) SAP Ariba Central Invoice Management and b) SAP Ariba Central Invoice Management, Inbound Processing Module.

I want guidance upon on what basis we can decide whether to take Inbound processing module license or not to take...what are its specific uses which are not included in SAP Ariba Central Invoice Management license.

Help in this regards will be greatly appreciated..

Note - I have been reading lots and lots of content related to SAP ARiba central invoice management from SAP but not getting answers to my queries.

Regards

Megha

entry.title: Crystal reports + zebra cut options
entry.content:
A customer uses Crystal reports for printing labels, these labels comes within a batch of serveral copies.  The bought a zebra printer with cutting option. The want to cut the label after the last print of the batch. Within Bartender this is working, but when we're printing form crystal reports, every label is cut.

We tried in the driver the followin command befoer and after printing

Before:   ^XA^MMD^XZ (setting the printer in delayed cut setting)
After last page/printjob:    ~JK (the cut command)

After the printjob is finished, no cutting action is placed. The labels will be cut when the next batch is printing. 
Anybody got a suggestion to fix this?

entry.title: Re: A production order compnonent material 101 mvmt displ...
entry.content:
Check the IDOC type and processing function module (e.g., MBGMCR, MBGMCR03). Confirm whether the IDOC is configured to trigger automatic confirmation or just goods receipt. Look at WE02/WE05 for the IDOC status — was it fully processed (status 53)?

In CO03, check:

  • Component Overview: Is the material flagged for backflush?
  • Control Key in routing: Does it allow automatic confirmation?
  • Confirmation parameters: Is auto-confirmation enabled?

If the component is marked for backflush but no confirmation occurred, check if work center or routing is missing backflush settings. Confirm that movement type 101 is correctly linked to the operation.

If IDOC triggers a BAPI (e.g., BAPI_GOODSMVT_CREATE), check whether confirmation logic is included. Look for any custom enhancement or user exit that might be suppressing confirmation.

entry.title: Re: Remove underline form hyperlink letters in SAC
entry.content: I faced the same issue while formatting links in SAC. What worked for me was adjusting the text style instead of the hyperlink property itself — changing the default font settings in the story theme helped remove the underline globally. It’s a small tweak but makes the dashboard look much cleaner.

entry.title: Re: Integrating SAP SuccessFactors with SAP Build Process Automation via SAP Cloud Application Event
entry.content:
Hi @emanuil_ivanov @acharyaw @EsmeeX 

We have an incident raised with SAP and the feedback we received is as follows: 

UCL is not able to process SF ORD because of an issue which was fixed as part of an internal fix. 

  • This fix is part of 2511 release of SF. That means it's still not available in this your environment. It will be deployed to preview environments this month (October) and to prod environments next month (November).

    As per our understanding, you are trying create "Events" project in SAP BPA. Here, if you use UCL as source, you don't see any events because of this error in processing SF ORD. 

    But as a workaround, you can use "SAP Business Accelerator Hub" as the source instead of Unified Cloud Landscape.

Hoping this works with the 2511 release 😐

entry.title: API for Product Availability
entry.content:
Hi,

we are running S/4Hana 2022 FPS01 and I was searching the Product Availability Service on api.sap.com. The services on api.sap.com lead me to this help page:  https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_ON-PREMISE/15f9e51998a945cc82545cb6b4dbe5c2/ba15d698dd474a57ad340f9acff13b99.html?version=2022.001

Basically there ate two APIs available on our release:

- Basic Product Availability Service -> The product availability information is calculated according to the default Available-to-Promise (ATP) logic and is influenced by the configuration applied in your system.

- Product Availability Info Service: no reference to which ATP version is used within the service implementation...

Does/Should any of these APIs use basic ATP in the background, since we still do not use aATP... Once I try them, I always get response that we are not using aATP... I found even this Blog: https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-sap/two-apis-to-retrieve-availability-information/ba-p/13576755

where it might looks like there is always aATP in the background...

If this is the case, is there any other API which still utilize ATP?

BR,

Milan

entry.title: dynamic break configuration not working for a second break after 6 hours & 44 minutes work time
entry.content:
Hi, 

We are trying to implement dynamic break configuration with below criteria:

1. If Working Time is equal or less than 4 hours and 14 mins, no breaks should be created.

2. If Working Time is equal to 4 hours and 15 mins up to 6 hours and 44 mins, 15 mins break should be created.

3. If Working Time is equal to 6 hours and 45 minutes up to whatever hours, additional 30 mins break should be created.

With total accumulated break of 45 mins.

Question: why the dynamic break is not created for criteria #3? when the dynamic break configuration is correctly set as:

Working Time duration: 6:44 (hh:mm)

Accumulated Break in minutes: 45

Thank you! appreciate any comments on this question!

entry.title: Re: pricing error: Mandatory condition ttx1 is missing
entry.content: The error is self explanatory.  TTX1 is a tax condition type which is set to Mandatory in your pricing procedure and for this condition type, no condition record is maintained in VK11.  Either you need to set as Optional instead of Mandatory depending upon the Business requirement or have to maintain condition record in VK11

entry.content: Clean core should be a "religion".

entry.title: Re: Capturing 2 STIP EMP group on Worksheet in SAP SF VPay
entry.content:
Hello!

You have the aggregated totals worksheet when you first open the form and then you’ll see the assignment details when you expand and this is where you find each change throughout the year. This should be what the customer wants and with some further training, hopefully, they’re able to adopt this level of design. 

There is no clear path way to what you want to do but, if you really need then, the two options I would consider;

- a custom field (or 2) that shows “Last STIP Assignment” and “Prior STIP Assignment” in the employee profile with an onChange business rule to populate the data when the primary STIP assignment is changed. The limitation is the volume of field you will be willing to have on the profile will limited the amount able to reference in the worksheet.

- to export the data via a report and load into a look up table for referencing. Limitation here is the quantity of employees, wouldn’t expect this approach to be very admin friendly.

 

Xavier might have some higher quality input here?

entry.title: Re: SAP Datasphere - Replication Flow (Delta Functionality)
entry.content:
@AnuragPakhidde Apologies for the delay in response, i had issues with my account login.

CDC mechanism will work with SAP BW ADO's, pre requisite is to DMIS add on to be installed in BW system and ODP configuration is enabled.

ADSO can be consumed to Datasphere through Replication flow with 'Initial' and 'Initial and Delta' options, recently SAP launched 'Delta' option and it works almost like 'Initial with Delta'.

HCPR can be used in Replication flow, but Delta feature will not be available. As Delta feature will based on request id and change log table, both features not available in HCPR.

Note: Even any ADSO without change log table also cannot perform delta transfer to Datasphere.

Creating CDS view on HCPR with Delta annotations would be option which i still need to explore, it would be great if it works. Please let me know the outcome if you have implemented this solution.

Thanks

Lokesh

entry.title: Re: BWZ CDM deployment – custom library fails to load (library.js / library-preload.js not found)
entry.content:
@Tahemmout I think the issue being solved in your last link is the absence of a sap.service.cloud. I did follow the SAP Help Link, so my app already has the three mandatory attributes described there:
- a business service (sap.service.cloud, that I also put at the end of the cdm destination: "/applications/cdm/cap-ui", and in my library manifest.json)

- a navigation intent (corssNavigation.inbounds)
- a translation folder (i18n)

I noticed that I didn't have

- name: srv-api
in my destination-content (even though I had it in my destination-service) so I added it, but it ididn't change anything. 

It is surprising that my error log are so similiar to the one from the community post you shared, even though I did not have the same missing code!

entry.title: Re: Invalid char # replacement
entry.content:
Hello,

Thank you very much for your question and sorry for the late reply.

You may want to try to modify your code and use UTF-8:

DATA(rv_data) = cl_bcs_convert=>xstring_to_string(
  iv_xstr = lv_xstring
  iv_cp   = 'UTF-8' ).

Please also check XString.

Kind regards,

Henrike
